R

RandomEventCard - Enum in card.random
 
RandomEventDeck - Class in card.random
This class implements the deck of Random Event cards.
RandomEventDeck() - Constructor for class card.random.RandomEventDeck
 
randomEventTest() - Method in class card.SymbolTest
Test RANDOM EVENT symbol
removeAllPiecesFromArea(int) - Method in class gameplay.Game
Removes all pieces from the area with the given number (see BoardArea.clearAllPieces()).
removeBuilding() - Method in class gameplay.BoardArea
 
removeBuilding(Player, int) - Method in class gameplay.Game
Removes a building on the area with the given ID, if one exists and also removes the corresponding city card form the player's hand.
removeCityCard(AnkhMorporkArea) - Method in class gameplay.Player
Removes the city area card corresponding to the given area from the player's hand.
removeDemon() - Method in class gameplay.BoardArea
Decrements the number of demons on the area.
Demons are regarded as minions so they will affect trouble in the area.
removeMinion(Player) - Method in class gameplay.BoardArea
This method removes the minion of the player from the city area, and justifies the balance of stocked minions.
removeMinion(int, Player) - Method in class gameplay.Game
Remove one minion belonging to the given player from the area with the given area ID.
removePlayerCard(GreenPlayerCard) - Method in class gameplay.Player
Removes the given player card from the player's hand.
removeTroll() - Method in class gameplay.BoardArea
Decrements the number of trolls on the area.
Trolls are regarded as minions so they will affect trouble in the area.
removeTroubleMarker() - Method in class gameplay.BoardArea
This method removes a trouble marker.
Returns true if there was previously a trouble marker on area.
reset() - Method in class card.city.CityAreaCard
Resets this cards "played" state to "not-played".
restorePlayerHand(Player) - Method in class gameplay.Controller
 
restorePlayerHand(Player) - Method in class gameplay.Game
Brings the given player's hand size back to 5 if it is less than that.
If no more player cards are available, the player's hand is left as it is at the time when the cards are up (the game should end after the player's turn is finished).
roll() - Method in class gameplay.Die
 
runMainMenu() - Method in class io.TextUserInterface
This method implements an interactive interface to:
Choose one of the following:
1) n to start a new game
2) l to load a previously saved game
3) o for an overview of the current game's status
4) s to save the current game
5) q to quit the game
